description: The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) intends to award a contract for the provision of community housing and residential services to offenders on conditional release or under statutory release. The Contractor must provide accommodation, monitoring, general support and assistance to offenders under federal jurisdiction who have been released to the community on conditional release, statutory release, and those subject to Long-Term Supervision Orders. The Contractor must also provide security services, including the monitoring of resident activities and destinations while away from the facility, and assist residents in their reintegration efforts by providing basic referral services to community support groups and other agencies, as dictated by each resident's individual requirements. The Contractor must provide ongoing liaison with local police agencies. The Contractor must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and obtain approved Document Safeguarding Capability at the level of PROTECTED B. The Contractor must also hold a valid RELIABILITY STATUS granted or approved by the CSP, PWGSC and comply with the provisions of the Security Requirements Check List and security guide. The Contractor must, in consultation with the Project Authority, determine the necessary life cycle stages such as procurement of essential goods and services, planning for delivery of work, delivery of the goods and services, testing, installation, operation, maintenance, repair, replacement, disposal of the goods and services etc. The Contractor must provide the work in the official language (English or French) asked by the offender, and at least one of the workers may be fluent in each official language. The acceptance criteria for the actions and obligations of the Contractor include being able to maintain breach records, complete findings and recommendations for breach, and continue contract meetings as agreed upon.

### Contract Information
* **Contract Title:** Community Housing Center (CHC) Contract
* **Contract Reference ID:** cantoon-trefIPeer contendSerIDADload
* **Department/Agency:** Correctional Service of Canada
* **Reporting Entity:** Centralized Contracts and Materials Management  
 
### Notice to Suppliers
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) hereby issues an Advanced Contract Award Notice (ACAN) for a Community Housing Center (CHC) Contract. This contract aims to provide care and services to adult offenders on conditional release in accordance with CSC's needs. Our preferred supplier, Maison Belfield, meets all necessary requirements, which includes being a non-profitable organization with a minimum of 2 years of experience providing accommodation for adult offenders in a residential setting.

### Contract Term
**Contract Period:** April 1, 2024 - March 31, 2025 (with the option to extend for 5 additional one-year periods)
**Estimated Contract Value:** \$ 1,806,420.41 (GST/HST extra)

### Expected Outcomes and Deliverables
The contractor must deliver:
- Residential services for federally-release offenders.
- Provision of security services, including monitoring activities and destinations while away from the service center.
- Assistance in reintegrating offenders in the community.
- Collaboration with local police agencies.

### Security Requirements
The contractor must comply with these requirements for security:
- Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and approved Document Safeguarding Capability at the PROTECTED B level.
- RELIABILITY STATUS for personnel requiring access to PROTECTED information.
- Compliance with the contract Security Requirements as per Annex  _____.

### What You Need to Do
To signal your interest to bid, please submit a Statement of Capabilities (SoC) by February 21, 2024, at 2:00 PM EDT to [eloise.clement@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:eloise.clement@csc-scc.gc.ca) including:

- Proof of capacity to meet the delivery of the required services.
- Proof of meeting the contract security requirements.

Please address any inquiries to the same email address.

Note: This announcement is open to Suppliers who meet the eligibility criteria, including those who are not in the pre-approved supplier list.
